trial_identification.studytitle: Insulin titration in General Practice: the TIME program TIME = treat initiate manage educate
trial_identification.scientifictitle: observational study in general practice of type 2 diabetics using a Diabetes Educator program to initiate and titrate insulin to improve HbA1c

interventions.interventions: diabetes education was provided on 3 occasions over 3 months and involved insulin initiation and review, titration and followup insulin initiation and titration was by a standard local protocol provided in consultation with each patient's GP based on BSL diary entries basal insulin was commenced at 10 units and titrated by 2 units every 3 days until the fasting BSL was <7 HbA1c was measured at baseline, 3 and 6 months

primaryOutcome.outcome: HbA1c was measured using Point of Care testing ie finger prick sample in the GP surgery. testing apparatus was a BioRad In2It machine

secondaryOutcome.outcome:
patient satisfaction was measured using a Diabetes Treatment Satisfaction Questionaire ( DTSQc Bradley)
qualitative interviews at exit from trial were conducted by a research nurse

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: type 2 diabetes HbA1c >7% inadequate control on oral medication
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: type 1 diabetes use of GLP analogues in previous 6 months

ethicsAndSummary.summary: 6 month observational study in general practice using a diabetes educator program to initiate and titrate insulin
